messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: [switch, cabbage,  T-giving,etc
messages.msgSnippet: Yours might. Mine belong to themselves. ... And if they did belong to god - well, I wouldn t beat anyone else s children! If he wants them beaten, let him do
messages.messageBody:
Yours might. Mine belong to themselves.

sheran@... wrote:

>
> > I come back to: Our children are not our children...they do NOT
> belong to us.
>
> No, they don't. They belong to God.
> Sheila

And if they did belong to god - well, I wouldn't beat anyone else's
children! If he wants them beaten, let him do it himself.

Carol

messages.subject: Re: [switch, cabbage,  T-giving,etc
messages.msgSnippet: ... the ... convictions. ... belong to us. No, they don t.  They belong to God. Sheila
messages.messageBody:
--- In Unschooling-dotcom@y..., KathrynJB@a... wrote:
> In a message dated 11/25/2001 4:50:40 PM Eastern Standard Time,
> Unschooling-dotcom@y... writes:
>
>
> > > We, as a country, need to stop
> > > trying to usurp God-given parental authority and give parents
the
> > > freedom to raise their children according to their own
convictions.
> >
> >
> >
> I come back to: Our children are not our children...they do NOT
belong to us.

No, they don't. They belong to God.
Sheila

messages.subject: Re: [switch, cabbage,  T-giving,etc
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 11/25/2001 4:50:40 PM Eastern Standard Time, ... I come back to:  Our children are not our children...they do NOT belong to us. Kathryn
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 11/25/2001 4:50:40 PM Eastern Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:


> > We, as a country, need to stop
> > trying to usurp God-given parental authority and give parents the
> > freedom to raise their children according to their own convictions.
>
>
>
I come back to: Our children are not our children...they do NOT belong to us.

Kathryn
